summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from 2019 between Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex and Edward Tyrrell, with others copied, requesting and approving travel for the Epstein investigation team (case 2018R01618) to conduct victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, Florida. It reveals ongoing investigative activity after Epstein's 2019 arrest.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: The primary sender of multiple travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation team to conduct victim interviews in Los Angeles and Florida.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: The recipient of travel requests; grants approval for the investigative travel related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on several travel request emails, indicating involvement in the Epstein investigation logistics.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Copied on a travel request email for an interview in Los Angeles.

connections.description: Alex requests and Edward Tyrrell approves travel for the Epstein investigation team, indicating a supervisor-subordinate or approval chain relationship within the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Michele Duncan is consistently copied on travel requests, suggesting collaborative involvement in the Epstein investigation team's activities.
Darlene Alleyne is copied on a specific travel request, indicating she is part of the professional network involved in the investigation logistics.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The investigation team requests travel to Los Angeles to conduct an interview as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: The investigation team requests travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, to conduct an interview.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: A prior travel request for a victim interview in Los Angeles, indicating ongoing investigative efforts in mid-2019.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel requested for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida
events.description: An early travel request for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
Multiple travel requests in 2019 show active victim interviews were being conducted in Los Angeles and Florida after Epstein's arrest.
The emails indicate a standard procedure for securing travel approval and hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews.
The correspondence reveals coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the Epstein investigation logistics.
The timeline shows investigative activity from at least March through November 2019, indicating sustained effort in the case.
